    CQLStatement

    public class CreateTableStatement
extends SchemaAlteringStatement
    A CREATE TABLE parsed from a CQL query statement.

                                     throws RequestValidationException
        Description copied from class: SchemaAlteringStatement
        Announces the migration to other nodes in the cluster.
        Specified by:
        announceMigration in class SchemaAlteringStatement
        Returns:
        the schema change event corresponding to the execution of this statement, or null if no schema change has occurred (when IF NOT EXISTS is used, for example)
        Throws:
        RequestValidationException

      • grantPermissionsToCreator

        protected void grantPermissionsToCreator(QueryState state)
        Description copied from class: SchemaAlteringStatement
        Schema alteration may result in a new database object (keyspace, table, role, function) being created capable of having permissions GRANTed on it. The creator of the object (the primary role assigned to the AuthenticatedUser performing the operation) is automatically granted ALL applicable permissions on the object. This is a hook for subclasses to override in order to perform that grant when the statement is executed.
        Overrides:
        grantPermissionsToCreator in class SchemaAlteringStatement

      • metadataBuilder

        public CFMetaData.Builder metadataBuilder()

      • getCFMetaData

        public CFMetaData getCFMetaData()
        Returns a CFMetaData instance based on the parameters parsed from this CREATE statement, or defaults where applicable.
        Returns:
        a CFMetaData instance corresponding to the values parsed from this statement
        Throws:
        InvalidRequestException - on failure to validate parsed parameters

        public TableParams params()
